fields.description:
When a JIRA project is created with an [invalid project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Project+Key+Format] the project administrator won't be able to access the versions, components and roles pages.

*Steps to reproduce :*
# Create a project with key '1234' (all numeric)
# Try to go to Project administration ->  Versions, Components and Roles
# The page does not display and shows a progress bar infinitely.


*Resolution :*
Change the project key to a valid format
fields.summary: No access to Project-Administration pages Versions, Components and Roles
Project specific email formatting settings

fields.summary: jira-config.properties file doesn't affect anything

fields.description:
I have jira-system-administrators access (can do everything for JIRA including installation of add-ons) but I cannot use the field "issuelinks" in my filters.

Sample

project = abc and issuetype = issue and issuelinks is empty

Could you please help me figure out why this is not permitted? How can I get access?

I can however, display this field and is shown as Links.
fields.summary: Unable to use field "issuelinks"

fields.description:
The supposedly pop up message will become a page 


Steps to reproduce:
1. Log in as Admin (with global privileges) to JIRA
2. Create a custom field.  Select Group Picker (single group)
3. Create a JIRA issue and fill in SUMMARY and then click CREATE button
4. Browse to that JIRA issue and click ADMIN button (see 1.png)
5. Then select ADD FIELD.  Now select the custom field you want to add. (Here I select 'single_grpJIRA')
6. Now input a non existing group.  It will prompt a warning message
7. Click on the people icon and a javascript alert will appear.  Click 'Leave this page' button

Observed behavior:
The page will change and will route to the GROUP PICKER pop up.  From here, you can click the user list but it will not route you back to the JIRA issue.  The flow is not broken.

Expected behavior:
The one displayed in the page should have been opened as a pop up message (see attached 'error_single grp picker.zip' for the video)
fields.summary: Add field dialog does not display the group picker pop-up correctly

fields.description:
If user have "Browse Users" permission then can see all users in watchers suggestion list instead of only users from this particular project.
Adding user apart from project is not possible  (message "User doesn't have permission to this project" is displayed) but usernames are visible. 
This is problem for us because we wouldn't like to show customers other customer names.

I've created another issue JRA-37551 which in our company scenario are related to each other.
fields.summary: "Browse Users" permission allows to see all JIRA users instead of from project issue is.

fields.description:
In our company we are using the following scenario:
Customer users don't have *Browse Users* global permission (we dont want they have possibility to see other customer usernames) but they have *View Voters and Watchers* permission and *Manage Watchers*.

As a result of this is that they can add watchers to the issues but they have to know exact usernames. They can do it in *Issue View* but they can't do it in "Detail View". This is caused probably by request 
{code}
/rest/api/1.0/users/picker?showAvatar=true&query=s&_=1395241798570
{code} which is sent some onKey event. This request is not sent in *Issue View*. 
For me would be the best if you completely get rid of this additional request in *Detail View*.
fields.summary: Adding watchers is not possible in Detail View when user doesn't have "Browse Users" permission.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce : 
# Create a checkbox custom field that is only available for some issue types *not all*
# Create some issues and add some value for this custom field
# Now create a filter that displays these issues on issue navigator
# Now add the checkbox custom field as one of the columns
# Notice that the column is added
# Refresh the page
# Notice that the column has disappeared. It does not stick on the issue navigator.

Workaround :
Make the custom field available to all issue types
fields.summary: Checkbox custom field column does not stick on Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37548].
  {panel}

Referring to [Connecting JIRA to SQL Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008] documentation. We asked users to set the following while setting up the database:
* SET NOCOUNT OFF
* SET READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON

Some users may have missed these important requirement and causes problems on their instances. Wouldn't it be great if JIRA could check these settings when SQL Server is selected during Database Setup?

And when we managed to run the check, I believe we should be able to alter the database as well.
fields.summary: Checks and Automatically Update to the Required Setting when Connecting JIRA to SQL Server
Plugin Guide is outdated

fields.description:
SSL support seems to be a big critical issues with JIRA that was ignored for quite some time.

SSL certificates are usually replaced once a year (average), and considering the number of system that JIRA has to interact with the number of certificates could easily go above 15 / jira instance. 

Why? Just count few other instances to connect with: JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, Crucible, SMTP servers, IMAP servers, ....

Now JIRA fails to validate even certificates that are recognized perfectly by all 5 major browsers, requiring admins to manually add the certificates to the truststore *and* to restart JIRA.

So, if you have a JIRA instance with ~15 certificates you would be required to restart JIRA ~15 times an year (every ~20 days) just to repair broken communication with other systems.

This is something unacceptable for a system that is supposed to be up 24x7.

There are at least two things that have to be fixed here:
* Accept any SSL certificates that are globally acceptable.
* Provide a way to install new certificated that does not require instance restart.

Ideally, SSL authentications from AppLinks windows, SMTP and IMAP/POP3 should prompt the user to accept a new certificates.
fields.summary: JIRA does not validate SSL certificates and requires restart on any certificate changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37538].
  {panel}

JIRA is very sensitive to database encoding/collation which results in errors during upgrade as well as normal application functioning if the collation specified is not correct.

It would be easier for JIRA administrators if JIRA would warn of improper collation during
# Installation
# Upgrade
# Startup

The following are the SQL queries for checking database collation for the different supported databases:

h3.Oracle: How to check database encoding for Oracle database
{code}SQL> SELECT * FROM NLS_DATABASE_PARAMETERS WHERE PARAMETER='NLS_CHARACTERSET';

PARAMETER        |   VALUE
----------------------------------------------------------------------
NLS_CHARACTERSET | AL32UTF8
{code}

h3.MySQL: How to check database collation for MySQL database
{code}mysql> SELECT * FROM information_schema.SCHEMATA S where SCHEMA_NAME = "jiradb";
+--------------+-------------+----------------------------+------------------------+----------+
| CATALOG_NAME | SCHEMA_NAME | DEFAULT_CHARACTER_SET_NAME | DEFAULT_COLLATION_NAME | SQL_PATH |
+--------------+-------------+----------------------------+------------------------+----------+
| def          | jiradb      | utf8                       | utf8_bin               | NULL     |
+--------------+-------------+----------------------------+------------------------+----------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
{code}

h3.PostgreSQL: How to check database collation for PostgreSQL database
{code}psql=# SELECT datname, pg_encoding_to_char(encoding), datcollate, datctype FROM pg_database WHERE datname = 'jiradb';
 datname | pg_encoding_to_char | datcollate  |  datctype
---------+---------------------+-------------+-------------
 jiradb  | UTF8                | en_AU.UTF-8 | en_AU.UTF-8
{code}

h3.Microsoft SQL Server: How to check database collation for MS SQL database
{code}SELECT name, collation_name FROM sys.databases WHERE name='jiradb';
+--------------+----------------------------------+
| name         | collation_name                   |
+--------------+----------------------------------+
| jiradb       | SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI   | 
+--------------+----------------------------------+
{code}
fields.summary: Warn about unsupported database encoding/collation during installation, upgrade and startup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37537].
  {panel}

Vitaliy, an add-on vendor, was getting 401 responses when attempting to POST to the /rest/api/2/issue REST API endpoint. 401 indicates that authentication is required but has not been provided. However, he eventually discovered that his query content needed to change.

The red herring wasted his time and ours.

For more info see:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/atlassian-connect-dev/BauvsLkj9Ng/WnlxiwE11I8J
fields.summary: 401 response from /rest/api/2/issue unrelated to authentication

# use the REST API to update an issue (use /rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\})

As per https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e1698 200 is expected, not 204.
Probably this should be fixed on master not on stable to be kind to any developers using a workaround that looks for 204 instead of 200.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37535].
  {panel}

It would be very helpful to me if the JIRA REST api included a method for creating new projects (which included the ability to set all attributes for the project).

Right now only option I can see for scripted creating of projects via an api appears to be the Soap api which only has a limited createProject function that doesn't allow some project attributes to be set;
Namely as far I can see it's lacking the ability to set:
* category for the project
* issue type scheme for the project
* notification email (the email address used in the from field of notification emails)
* screen scheme
* workflow scheme
* field scheme
So projects created via it still have to be updated by hand to set the remaining attributes.   (which means we can't automate our project creation workflow fully)
fields.summary: REST api method for creating a project (including setting all project attributes)

fields.description:
During testing of JIRA 6.2 the mobile version of the page doesn't load (tested https://jira/plugins/servlet/mobile using both Chrome on my desktop and iOS emulator).

{code}
Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function batch.js:1573
Uncaught TypeError: Property 'require' of object [object Object] is not a function
{code}
We have disabled minification on the tested server {{-Datlassian.webresource.disable.minification=true}} so I was able to find the error. It looks like the {{zepto.js}} isn't semicolon-terminated and due to the resource batching it causes JS error, see !Screen Shot 2014-03-18 at 16.14.38 .png|thumbnail!
This might affect previous versions too.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37529].
  {panel}

Users are blocked out after being added to the atlassian-addons group.  

This group is not meant to grant any permissions, and is intended for use only with Atlassian Connect.  Installing an Atlassian Connect add-on creates a user, who is added to this group automatically.  This user's permissions, together with the scopes white list determine which API calls an add-on can make. 

Users should not be able to add anyone to this group, and right now it's completely blocking people from logging in if they are added.

*Workaround:* Remove users from the atlassian-addons group.
fields.summary: Users receive "Invalid Credentials" when added to atlassian-addons group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37521].
  {panel}

*Resolution*
* JIRA now uses the extension of the file to determine if it is a zip, instead of opening and inspecting the top of the file.
* If it is a zip, the description of the entries is cached so the zip doesn't need to be opened again.

---
Steps to reproduce:

# Create an issue and reload it a few times; observe the page load times on average.
# Create a zip file with about 10 files at the root.
# Attatch it to an issue 10-20 times.
# Refresh the issue and now observe the average page load times.

The problem is that the jira-view-issue-plugin extracts every single Zip File attached to an issue on every page load. See: jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-view-issue-plugin/src/main/resources/viewissue/attachmentsblock.vm

This should be turned into an asynchronous operation so that, only when a user clicks on the drop-down arrow for that attachment do we fire a rest call and get the data, performing the extraction in that operation.

In the long term we should even consider Connecting that location for Cloud so that we can pull zip file extraction out into a shared service.
fields.summary: Browsing an Issue is very slow on a page with many Zip Attachments and Zip Support enabled.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37517].
  {panel}

There are times where 1) either the workflow designer forgot to put in a transition for an end state to allow the user to take it back to an initial state (e.g. Reopen) or 2) The process changes where you need to allow for a transition from an end state that may no longer be the end state.

Currently, you cannot do this without much hassle.  You have to copy the old one so that it is inactive, add your states and transitions.  

Then, create a new workflow scheme to where you associate this new workflow to the appropriate issue types. 

Then change the workflow scheme.

There is no option to just switch out an existing workflow with a new one for an issue type since when you remove it, you have to indicate what to migrate issues to that typically go to your unassigned issues - if you do that, we would lost all valid states.  Thus, you have to switch out the entire workflow scheme. 

In this same light, if a status is no longer be referenced in a workflow, can you please allow us to delete it.  Again, you have to follow the same process as above as you can only delete through the copy, create the new scheme, and apply the new scheme.  Again, as process changes, workflows will too and I want to keep the workflow as clean as possible and not have these random statuses in it that are not being uses.
fields.summary: Allow adding transitions to an end status as well as delete status no longer in use

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37516].
  {panel}

I want to be able to have a "Team" dashboard that any person can use and it shows them the tickets that are for the team that person is part of. It is similar to how the function currentUser() works in filters to apply to gadgets in the dashboard.
So instead of doing a filter that looks like this & each team manager having to create a copy & a copy of the dashboard:
project = TT AND Categories not in (Project) AND (assignee in membersOf(OPERATIONS_SRE) OR "Assignee group" = OPERATIONS_SRE AND assignee is EMPTY) ORDER BY priority DESC, duedate ASC
I want to be able to do this for one dashboard that every manager can use for "their team":
project = TT AND Categories not in (Project) AND (assignee in membersOf(currentUsersTeam()) OR "Assignee group" = currentUsersTeam() AND assignee is EMPTY) ORDER BY priority DESC, duedate ASC

Ps.: This functionality probable require a definition of a new entity on the user model: "user team". The list of "user teams" differ from the list of user groups because the last one include all the login groups.

Similar discussion: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/251082/filter-to-pick-up-requests-for-all-users-in-current-group-dynamic-passing-of-group-name
fields.summary: Team Dashboard

h3. Current behaviour

When the user creates a project in JIRA, there user has a lot of options to choose between different project templates. After the project is created, you will have to manually modify the workflows, issue types, etc. involved in the project, as there is no option to modify the whole project template.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want the possibility of modifying the project template as an "Edit" option, so we don't have to associate all the changes involved in the template. This should also allow for applying project templates to previously created projects that were not created with a new template.

Clicking on the *Issue* tab in the JIRA toolbar, will list the filters. If user has a lot of filters (more than 10 saved filters) and has the screen resolution at 1280x720, users will encounter the issue.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Screen Resolution to 1280 x 720
#* We support a minimum of 1024 x 768 as mentioned in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms
# Create 10-15 saved filters
# Click on the Issues tab

h4. Expected
The filter list should be automatically scrollable

h4. Actuality
It tries to list all the filters as seen in the attached screenshots
!Chrome_1280x720.png!

h4. Workaround
You can configure to show certain number of dropdown issue history and issue filter  for the "View Issue" tab by doing the following
# Shutdown JIRA
# Edit {{jira-config.properties}} located in $JIRA_HOME to add the following (Create one if there is none yet)
{noformat}     jira.max.issue.filter.dropdown.items  = 5
     jira.max.issue.history.dropdown.items = 3{noformat}
# Save and restart JIRA

fields.description:
Hi,

I spent much time doing the following:

1. Hit resolve on one of my JIRA issues.
2. Typed a long set of comments into the comment box.
3. The JIRA spellchecker kept trying to autocorrect a word in the wrong way so I hit the ESC key on my keyboard to make it go away.  This is the standard way of doing this on OS X.
4. JIRA dismissed the resolve popup without my permission and without asking me first.  JIRA blew away all of my comments that I had just typed in the popup.  They were nowhere to be found and I could not recover them.  I had to retype them.

This is totally incorrect behavior.  The standard idiom on OS X is that hitting escape makes the spell checker go away.

I am in 7.0.2 on OS X 10.9.2.

Sorry for the stern tone, I know you guys work hard and I generally like your products.  But I lost 10 minutes worth of typing because of this and had to spend another 10 minutes retyping.

This is a serious bug which greatly reduces the usability of JIRA.

Please let me know if you need any more details.  I can reproduce this every time.

Thanks,

Joel
fields.summary: Hitting escape while typing comments in popup resolve box should NOT dismiss the box and blow away my comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37475].
  {panel}

As reported by [~kavian]:
{quote}
We discovered scalability problems with the implementation of four of the gadgets provided by jira-gadgets-plugin:
* Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics
* Issue Statistics
* Pie Chart
* Heat Map

All four of these use a similar implementation where the internal value objects for the "count-by" field are loaded into memory for all issues returned by the filter...and this is done in a loop, so the objects will continue to be loaded into memory with no opportunity for garbage collection.  In cases where there are a large number of values, this can cause JIRA to run out of memory, which causes the application to fail and require restart.

Most of our outages have corresponded to the use of one of these gadgets where the "count-by" field was a user field (e.g. Reporter, Assignee, or a custom User Picker), so this leads us to believe that there may also be scalability issues with the new ApplicationUser implementations.  However, we aren't as certain about this last part, since at least one of our outages did not involve a user field.

We have mitigated the immediate impact of this problem by notifying our users of this behaviour, and asking them not to use these gadgets with large datasets.  However, we would like this to be addressed properly to eliminate the risk of accidental outage, and to allow our users to use these gadgets as needed.

The following is the details of the execution path that leads to outage (this is the trace for the Issue Statistics gadget, but a similar path exists for the other three gadgets):

* the {{/rest/gadget/1.0/stats/generate}} call maps to com.atlassian.jira.gadgets.system.StatsResource.*getData*

* on line 145 in the getData method, a com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.StatisticAccessorBean object is created

* on line 148 in the getData method, the *getWrapper* method of the StatisticAccessorBean object is called, and this is what essentially pulls the data (the rest of the getData method is prepping the results for output)
** the getData method also creates a StatisticsMapper object (line 144) and passes it to the getWrapper method
*** for counts by Assignee, this is a com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.AssigneeStatisticsMapper object, which is really a simple extension of com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.UserStatisticsMapper

* after the getWrapper method pulls the data, it iterates through the results and translates each GenericValue to a real object (line 198 in StatisticAccessorBean) using the *getValueFromLuceneField* method of the StatisticsMapper

* UserStatisticsManager.getValueFromLuceneField is implemented using an instance of its inner class *UserManagerResolver*

* UserManagerResolver.apply calls JIRA's UserManager.getUserByKey method to get the ApplicationUser instance, and passes that into ApplicationUsers.toDirectoryUser to get the embedded-Crowd User object
** this is what is being repeated for every Assignee found in the search result
** the embedded-Crowd User objects (and possibly the ApplicationUser objects) are not released for garbage collection until the entire user operation has completed
{quote}
fields.summary: Implementation of certain gadgets may cause performance degradation

fields.description:
I'm developing a complex custom field, and some properties use a textarea. I need to create the visual controls with Javascript because the properties change depending on a "type" property. So far so good. However, when it shows the inline edit, the textarea has a hardcoded height of 278px. When I inspect the HTML, there is a "style="height: 278px;"" out of nothing in it, even when I set explicitly "set style="height: 56px;""
In the edit dialog the text areas look OK, so in the inline edit someone is overwriting my style. And even if I don't set a height (which was my first approach), it is set the height with an inline style. In both cases (dialog and inline) the textarea have the class "textarea full-width-field"
The textarea dimensions are 598x272 (~2.2 ratio), in case this means something.
The inline editor is populated, of course, in the NEW_CONTENT_ADDED event, as from the tutorials, while the editor and creation dialogs are populated from the Velocity template itself:
 There is also a "Add" button to add items, and when I add new items from it, the created textareas have the correct height, whether the one I explicitly set via "style", or the default.

Originally posted in Atlassian Answers[1]. Refer there for more details
[1]https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/271524/text-area-height-in-custom-field-control

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37454].
  {panel}

I've filed this as a support request, however Oswaldo Hernandez has asserted that this is a bug and should be filed as a bug report, here:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30451?focusedCommentId=576712&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-576712

I'm working on porting a custom email handler that was originally written for JIRA 5.1.6 to JIRA 6.1.7. The plugin compiles just fine, however it crashes at runtime with the following message:

[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'com.omit.omit.EditHandlerDetailsWebAction': Instantiation of bean failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Could not instantiate bean class [com.omit.omit.EditHandlerDetailsWebAction]: Constructor threw exception; nested exception is java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/jira/plugins/mail/model/HandlerDetailsModel

Apparently it's not currently possible to include this class in JIRA 6.x.

Details here as well: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/265936/plugin-porting-issue-noclassdeffounderror-com-atlassian-jira-plugins-mail-model-handlerdetailsmodel
fields.summary: Refactor JIRA Mail Plugin to provide better API for plugin developers

fields.description:
I have seen this on more than more filter, so I'll give just one example.  We have a filter set up for current/next version issues and it is defined as such:

fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() AND status not in ("Ready for Release", "Awaiting Code Review", "Awaiting QA", Closed) AND (assignee is EMPTY OR status in ("In Progress")) ORDER BY fixVersion, priority, status, timeestimate ASC, key

When viewing these via the issue navigator they are sorted as expected.  When viewing them via the dashboard gadget they are in a different order.  I do see if sorting by fixVersion and priority.  All of the tickets are currently in the same status, so I cannot tell if it is applying it to the sort order or not.  The variance comes with the last two ORDER BY fields (timeestimate and key).  These are not being applied to the dashboard filtering.
fields.summary: Order of results different between Issue Navigator and Dashboard Filter

fields.description:
Team,

I believe we have a Bug in Jira 6 where the logic described in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+are+the+'suggestions'+calculated+in+the+Assignee+dropdown] is not working. This was reported by one of our customers and I was also able to replicate on my side using a clean JIRA 6 instance.

h3. Expected Results
The suggestions in Assignee dropdown are calculated in the following manner :
First Jira picks up a list of last (maximum) 5 users that the current user has assigned issues to (say Tony, Jack, Alex, Rita, James).
Then Jira picks up a list of users that this issue has been assigned to in the past (say Ram).
After this, Jira adds to this, the reporter of this issue (say Ram).
After this, the list is compiled and the duplicates are removed (with above example we will have Tony, Jack, Alex, Rita, James, Ram in the list).
Lastly, they are arranged in the ascending order (Alex, Jack, James, Ram, Rita, Tony) and then displayed in the Assignee dropdown.

h3. Actual Results 
The logic described above doesn't work. Some of the users are still missing even after being the last assignee.

*KB Source:* 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+are+the+'suggestions'+calculated+in+the+Assignee+dropdown
fields.summary: How are the 'suggestions' calculated in the Assignee dropdown
